channel.title: NPR Programs: Morning Edition
channel.description: Morning Edition takes listeners around the country and the world with multi-faceted stories and commentaries every weekday. Hosts Steve Inskeep, Leila Fadel, Michel Martin and A Martínez bring you the latest breaking news and features to prepare you for the day.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Senate to hold 7th vote as government shutdown drags on
item.description: After six failed attempts, the Senate will vote again Thursday to end the shutdown, as both parties continue to trade blame over who is stopping the government from reopening.
item.content:encoded: After six failed attempts, the Senate will vote again Thursday to end the shutdown, as both parties continue to trade blame over who is stopping the government from reopening.
item.dc:creator: Deirdre Walsh

item.title: Illinois Sen. Dick Durbin on the shutdown and the National Guard troops in his state
item.description: NPR's Leila Fadel speaks with Sen. Dick Durbin, D-Ill., about the government shutdown and the Trump administration's deployment of National Guard troops to the Chicago area.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Leila Fadel speaks with Sen. Dick Durbin, D-Ill., about the government shutdown and the Trump administration's deployment of National Guard troops to the Chicago area.
item.dc:creator: Leila Fadel

item.title: 59% of Americans disapprove of RFK Jr.'s moves as health secretary, a new poll says
item.description: A new poll shows trust in federal health policies is plummeting, and what — or who — people believe increasingly depends on their politics.
item.content:encoded:
A new poll shows trust in federal health policies is plummeting, and what — or who — people believe increasingly depends on their politics.

(Image credit: Win McNamee)
item.dc:creator: Yuki Noguchi

item.title: Morning news brief
item.description: Israel and Hamas reach initial deal on ceasefire, Senate set for seventh vote as government shutdown stalemate continues, Illinois will try to block the National Guard deployment in court Thursday
item.content:encoded: Israel and Hamas reach initial deal on ceasefire, Senate set for seventh vote as government shutdown stalemate continues, Illinois will try to block the National Guard deployment in court Thursday
item.dc:creator: Leila Fadel

item.title: Man arrested in connection with starting deadly Palisades Fire
item.description: Federal authorities have arrested a 29-year-old man for setting a fire in January that later turned into the Palisades Fire, which killed 12 people and destroyed more than 6,000 structures.
item.content:encoded: Federal authorities have arrested a 29-year-old man for setting a fire in January that later turned into the Palisades Fire, which killed 12 people and destroyed more than 6,000 structures.
item.dc:creator: Steve Futterman

item.title: Facing mounting pressure, French president expected to soon name new prime minister
item.description: French President Emmanuel Macron is expected to name the country's next prime minister by Friday, after his third prime minister in a year resigned earlier this week.
item.content:encoded: French President Emmanuel Macron is expected to name the country's next prime minister by Friday, after his third prime minister in a year resigned earlier this week.
item.dc:creator: Eleanor Beardsley

item.title: Former U.S. surgeons general call RFK Jr. a threat to the nation's health in op-ed
item.description: Six former U.S. surgeons general issued a warning about Health Secretary RFK Jr., calling him a "threat." NPR's A Martinez speaks with one of them, former U.S. Surgeon General Richard Carmona.
item.content:encoded: Six former U.S. surgeons general issued a warning about Health Secretary RFK Jr., calling him a "threat." NPR's A Martinez speaks with one of them, former U.S. Surgeon General Richard Carmona.
item.dc:creator: A Martínez

item.title: Should taxes help pay for childcare? Voters in Colorado will decide next month
item.description: Voters in three Colorado counties will decide in November whether to form a special tax district to fund childcare, which is becoming less affordable for families in the state.
item.content:encoded: Voters in three Colorado counties will decide in November whether to form a special tax district to fund childcare, which is becoming less affordable for families in the state.
item.dc:creator: Sarah Tory

item.title: Data says inflation has fallen, so why do Americans feel like they're being pinched
item.description: Inflation is down since its peak during the pandemic, but the feeling of sticker shock still lingers. Planet Money looks into why feelings about prices diverge so much from official inflation data.
item.content:encoded: Inflation is down since its peak during the pandemic, but the feeling of sticker shock still lingers. Planet Money looks into why feelings about prices diverge so much from official inflation data.
item.dc:creator: Kenny Malone

item.title: László Krasznahorkai wins 2025 Nobel Prize in literature
item.description: The Hungarian writer, known for his apocalyptic works, has won the 2025 Nobel Prize in literature. He joins the ranks of Ernest Hemingway, John Steinbeck and Toni Morrison.
item.content:encoded: The Hungarian writer, known for his apocalyptic works, has won the 2025 Nobel Prize in literature. He joins the ranks of Ernest Hemingway, John Steinbeck and Toni Morrison.
item.dc:creator: Elizabeth Blair
